calcofi4r 0.1.2

  • Changelog

    Oceanographic DIC data

    dic.Rd

    CalCOFI collects samples for inorganic carbon and total alkalinity at specific stations throughout the cruise track. Seawater samples are collected from several depths, preserved and brought back to SIO for total inorganic carbon and total alkalinity analysis. These measurements allow the calculation of pH and pCO2. The objectives of these measurements are: first, the long-term characterization of the inorganic carbon system and its response to changing ocean climate, and second, measurements of pH in the coastal zone in order to monitor the anthropogenic impact on coastal ecosystems in the Southern California Bight.

    dic

    Format

    A data frame with 35376 rows and 82 variables

    Cst_Cnt

    Cast Count - All CalCOFI casts ever conducted, consecutively numbered

    Cruise_ID

    Cruise identifier Year-Month-Day-C-Ship Code

    Cruise.x

    Cruise Name Year

    Cruz_Sta

    Cruise Name and Station Year[Line][Station]

    DbSta_ID

    Line and Station

    Cast_ID

    Cast Identifier Century - [YY][MM][ShipCode] - CastType - CastTime-Line

    Sta_ID

    Line and Station

    Quarter

    Quarter of the year

    Sta_Code

    Station Designation (See Station_ID and 0-St_Code for codes)

    Distance

    Nautical miles from coast intercept, calculated from estimated latitude and longitude

    Date

    Date (Month Day Year)

    Year

    Year

    Month

    Month

    Julian_Date

    OA Date: days since December 30, 1899

    Julian_Day

    Julian Day of the year

    Time

    Time (UTC) CTD reached terminal depth

    Lat_Dec

    Observed Latitude in decimal degrees

    Lat_Deg

    Observed Latitude in degrees

    Lat_Min

    Observed Latitude in minutes

    Lat_Hem

    Observed Latitude Hemisphere

    Lon_Dec

    Observed Longitude in decimal degrees

    Lon_Deg

    Observed Longitude in degrees

    Lon_Min

    Observed Longitude in minutes

    Lon_Hem

    Observed Longitude Hemisphere

    Rpt_Line

    Reported Line Number

    St_Line

    Nearest Standard Line

    Ac_Line

    Calculated actual line from observed latitude and longitude

    Rpt_Sta

    Reported Station Number

    St_Station

    Nearest Standard Station Number

    Ac_Sta

    Calculated actual station from observed lat and long

    Bottom_D

    Bottom depth in meters

    Secchi

    Secchi disk depth in meters

    ForelU

    Water color; Only used in CalCOFI dataset from 1988-10 through 1998-04 (Forel-Ule Scale)

    Ship_Name

    Ship's Name

    Ship_Code

    Ship's NODC Code

    Data_Type

    Data Type

    Order_Occ

    Order station was occupied (within each cruise)

    Event_Num

    Event number; includes all research opperations within each cruise (e.g. nets, CTD)

    Cruz_Leg

    Leg of cruise, if multiple legs

    Orig_Sta_ID

    IEH Reported Station ID

    Data_Or

    Data Origin, punch card short code used to designate the institution that collected the data (e.g. Scripps)

    Cruz_Num

    Cruise Designation (Year Month)

    IntChl

    Integrated Chlorophyll per half light day (milligrams chl per square meter per half light day)

    IntC14

    Integrated Primary Productivity per half light day (milligrams C per square meter per half light day)

    Inc_Str

    Incubation Start Time (PST)

    Inc_End

    Incubation End Time (PST)

    PST_LAN

    Time of Local Apparent Noon (PST)

    Civil_T

    Time of Civil Twilight (PST)

    TimeZone

    Time Zone

    Wave_Dir

    Wave Direction reported using an abbreviated 360° azimuth circle with 00 representing True North, 18 represents 180°

    Wave_Ht

    Wave Height in feet

    Wave_Prd

    Wave Period in seconds

    Wind_Dir

    Reported using an abbreviated 360 degree azimuth circle with 0 representing True North, 18 representing 180 degrees

    Wind_Spd

    Wind Speed in knots

    Barometer

    Millibars to the tenths

    Dry_T

    Dry Air Temperature from a Sling Psychrometer in degrees Celsius

    Wet_T

    Wet Air Temperature from a Sling Psychrometer in degrees Celsius

    Wea

    1 Digit Code from The World Meteorological Organization, Code source WMO 4501

    Cloud_Typ

    1 Digit Code from The World Meteorological Organization, Code source WMO 0500

    Cloud_Amt

    1 Digit Code from The World Meteorological Organization, Code source WMO 2700, in oktas

    Visibility

    1 Digit Code from The World Meteorological Organization, Code source WMO 4300

    Cast_Index

    CalCOFI Hydrographic Database Cast Table Index; 1 = CalCOFI database's 1st cast record

    Btl_Cnt

    CalCOFI Hydrographic Database Bottle Table Index; 1 = CalCOFI database's 1st bottle record

    Cruise.y

    CalCOFI Cruise Designation with century prefix; CalCOFI 0901 = 200901

    Depthm

    Sample Depth in meters

    Depth_ID

    Unique database index built from:Century-CruiseShip-Casttype-Julian DOY-UTC Time-LineSta-DepthDup-Record Indicator

    DIC1

    DIC Analysis - Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Measurement, first sample

    DIC2

    DIC Analysis - Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Measurement from a duplicate sample drawn from same depth as DIC 1

    TA1

    DIC Analysis - Total Alkalinity Measurement, first sample; same DIC bottle as DIC 1

    TA2

    DIC Analysis - Total Alkalinity Measurement from a duplicate sample drawn from same depth as TA 1

    pH1

    Spectrophotometrically measured pH per kilogram seawater

    pH2

    Spectrophotometrically measured pH per kilogram seawater from a duplicate sample drawn from same depth as pH 1

    Salinity1

    DIC Analysis - Salinity value from DIC 1 bottle

    Salinity2

    DIC Analysis - Salinity value from DIC 2 bottle

    Temperature_degC

    CTD Temperature from Bottle Sample Depth

    Bottle.Salinity

    CalCOFI Salinity Measurement from DIC Depth

    Bottle_O2_ml_L

    CalCOFI Oxygen Measurement in milliliters/liter, from DIC Depth

    Bottle_O2_µmol_kg

    CalCOFI Oxygen Measurement in umoles/Kg, from DIC Depth

    Sigma.theta

    Sigma-theta Density calculated from CalCOFI data

    DIC.Bottle_ID1

    DIC 1 Bottle Index Number

    DIC.Bottle_ID2

    DIC 2 Bottle Index Number

    DIC.Quality.Comment

    Quality Control Comments on DIC samples after processing

    Source

    https://calcofi.org/data/oceanographic-data/dic/

    Details

    DIC samples for Dave Keeling were also collected on CalCOFI stations 90.70, 90.90, & 90.120 from Sep 1986 (CalCOFI 8609NH) to Nov 2002 (CalCOFI 0211NH). In Aug 2008, DIC sampling restarted on 7 stations, grew to 10 stations in Jan 2011, and currently DIC has expanded substantially. Dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) and total alkalinity (TA) data have only been integrated into the CalCOFI hydrographic dataset since Aug 2008, then Jan 2009 through presently. Similarly, pH data have only been integrated into the CalCOFI hydrographic dataset since April 2014.

    Codes used in data set

    Sta_Code (Station Codes)

    • "ST" - Standard CalCOFI Station

    • "SCO" - SCCOOS nearshore/20m Station

    • "NRO" - Not Regularly Occupied Original CalCOFI Station

    • "OCO" - Occasionally CalCOFI Occupied

    • "IMX" - IMECOCAL Occupied

    • "NST" - Non-Standard Station

    • "MBR" - MBARI Occupied Station

    Data_Type (Data Type)

    • "PR" - Productivity Cast

    • "HY" - Hydrographic Cast

    • "10" - Ten-meter Cast

    • "CT" - Compressed CTD Cast (Low Resolution)

    • "MX" - Mixed CTD and Bottle Data

    _qual, qua, or q (Quality Code; associated with discrete samples; examples: "O_qual", "Chlqua", "PO4q")

    • Blank - Data OK

    • "4" - Value zeroed due to value below detection limit

    • "6" - Data taken from CTD sensor

    • "8" - Technician thinks value is suspect

    • "9" - Missing Data

    RecInd (Record Indicator)

    • "3" - Observed Data

    • "4" - Educated office guess (ghost)

    • "5" - Data from STD or CTD sensor

    • "6" - Duplicate Depth

    • "7" - Interpolated to a standard depth
